state: I hope you're ready to go into rooms and interact with objects, because you've just entered TextWorld! Here is how to play! First thing I need you to do is to go north. That done, lift the Canadian limited edition key from the floor of the spare room. Then, make an attempt to go to the south. And then, unlock the Canadian limited edition door inside the study. Then, open the Canadian limited edition door within the study. After that, travel west. And then, insert the non-euclidean keycard into the non-euclidean portal's lock to unlock it. Then, make sure that the non-euclidean portal within the studio is open. After that, make an effort to go to the west. Next, venture north. Okay, and then, make an effort to head west. Once you accomplish that, attempt to take a trip north. That done, go north. After that, recover the stick of butter from the floor of the cellar. That's it! -= Study =- You find yourself in a study. A standard one. There is a closed Canadian limited edition door leading west. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded. > -= Study =-0/1
next_state: -= Spare Room =- Well, here we are in a spare room. You decide to just list off a complete list of everything you see in the room, because hey, why not? You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded. There is a Canadian limited edition key on the floor. > -= Spare Room =-0/2

next_state: -= Canteen =- You are in a canteen. It seems to be pretty typical here. Oh, great. Here's a pan. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a plate. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it! You can make out a board. I guess it's true what they say, if you're looking for a board, go to TextWorld. But there isn't a thing on it. You can see a chair. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? The chair is typical. But there isn't a thing on it. There is an unguarded exit to the north. There is an exit to the south.
